text:
Noticed the following error messages in Jmeter logs:
2016/07/06 16:57:33 ERROR - com.helger.css.parser.ParserCSS30TokenManager: Illegal character: ? 
2016/07/06 16:57:33 ERROR - com.helger.css.parser.ParserCSS30TokenManager: Illegal character: ? 
2016/07/06 16:57:48 ERROR - com.helger.css.parser.ParserCSS30TokenManager: Illegal character: ! 
2016/07/06 16:57:48 ERROR - com.helger.css.parser.ParserCSS30TokenManager: Illegal character: !

The reason seems to be CSS parsing fails when there are special characters such as ? and !. The special chars ? and ! are used in CSS refs in the application that I am working on, there may be need for additional special chars support.

E.g. CSS link: <link href="/html/portlet/journal_content/css/main.css?browserId=other&minifierType=css&languageId=en_EN&b=6110&t=1466582050000" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />

This does not cause the script run to fail but ends up adding many error log entries to Jmeter log.

Workaround to avoid the error messages: Remove cssParser HTTPResponse parsers in jmeter.properties
creator: sbennet2k@gmail.com

text:
Hi,
Could you provide the CSS code that contains '!' and '?' ?
Thanks
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Hi,

Apologies. This in fact turns out to be a non-issue.

These css parser warning messages were reported when downloading embedded resources as part of request corresponding to a script that was created quite a while ago.

The problem seems to be with the User-Agent value. Updating the User-Agent value of the HTTP request resolved these warning messages.

Marking ticket as Resolved Invalid.

Cheers!
creator: sbennet2k@gmail.com
